marketNews.title: CPO Export Levy Rate to Increase to 10% Starting 2025
marketNews.content:
Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the government will raise the export levy rate for crude palm oil (CPO) from 7.5% to 10% starting January 2025. This increase is intended to support the B40 program or the use of 40% biofuel (BBN) for biodiesel, which is also planned to commence in early 2025. Meanwhile, the export levy rate for other processed palm oil products will be set at a minimum of 4.5% from the previous range of 3-6%.
This decision came only 3 months after the government lowered and simplified the CPO export levy tariff scheme from the progressive system to a single tariff of 7.5%.

The government targets biodiesel distribution to reach 15.6 million kiloliters (KL) in 2025, increasing from the 2024 target of 13.4 million KL along with the increase in BBN blending. According to the President Director of the Palm Oil Plantation Fund Management Agency (BPDPKS), Eddy Abdurrachman, the estimated funding requirement for biodiesel subsidies will reach 47 trillion rupiah in 2025. This estimation was conveyed in early November 2024 when the CPO price was around ~4,900 Malaysian Ringgit per ton.
Eddy revealed that the funds managed by BPDPKS are still adequate to support the B40 program next year if combined with projected revenue in 2025. Until the end of 2024, the balance of funds managed by BPDPKS is estimated to reach 31.8 trillion rupiah, while the projection for 2025 palm oil export levy revenue reaches 20.3 trillion rupiah with the existing tariff. Using the new tariff, palm oil export levies have the potential to reach 27.1 trillion rupiah.

Key Takeaway

The need for biodiesel subsidies will depend on how quickly the full implementation of the B40 program proceeds, as well as the movement of CPO and diesel prices. Higher export levy rates will increase certainty for the B40 program running in the coming years. However, with the current scheme, revenue run-rate, and expenditures, the biodiesel program has the potential to be unsustainable in the long term, especially if the government intends to increase blending to 50% or B50. On the other hand, the increase in the CPO export levy rate risks reducing the competitiveness of CPO compared to other vegetable oils, which could reduce demand.

On Monday's (23/12) trading, the CPO price strengthened +2.6% to the level of 4,548 Malaysian Ringgit per ton.

marketNews.title: US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Index
marketNews.content: The Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index in the US was recorded to have increased to 2.4% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: 2.3% YoY), below consensus expectations. On a monthly basis, PCE inflation reached 0.1% MoM (vs. October 2024: 0.2% MoM inflation). Meanwhile, the core PCE index—which is the long-term inflation indicator by the Fed—was recorded at 0.1% MoM (vs. October 2024: 0.3% MoM inflation). Annually, core PCE inflation reached 2.8% YoY (vs. October 2024: 2.8% YoY inflation), below consensus expectations.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Broad Money (M2) Growth
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that economic liquidity or broad money (M2) in November 2024 grew +7% YoY (vs. October 2024: +6.8% YoY). This growth was driven by the growth of narrow money (M1) by +9.1% YoY and quasi money by +2.3% YoY. Furthermore, M2 growth in November 2024 was also driven by developments in credit distribution and net claims on the central government. Credit distribution remained stable at +10.1% YoY. Meanwhile, net claims on the central government increased by +1.1% YoY (vs. October 2024: -0.1% YoY).

marketNews.title: Government Assesses VAT Hike Impact
marketNews.content: Head of the Fiscal Policy Agency (BKF), Febrio Kacaribu, stated that the agency believes the increase in VAT to 12% next year will not significantly disrupt purchasing power, so that economic growth in 2025 will remain above 5%. Febrio also mentioned that one buffer against inflationary pressure after the VAT increase is the package of food aid stimulus and electricity discounts.

marketNews.title: US President Demands Increased Oil and Gas Imports from EU
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump demanded that the European Union (EU) increase imports of oil and gas from the US. If they do not comply, Trump stated that the US will impose additional tariffs on EU goods exported to the US, including cars and machinery.

marketNews.title: IKN Authority Announces Groundbreaking for Stage 9 Projects
marketNews.content: The Nusantara Capital City Authority (IKN) announced that President Prabowo Subianto will execute the groundbreaking for stage 9 in IKN with an investment value nearing 6.5 trillion rupiah in early 2025. There are five domestic and international investors investing in five different sectors: residences, education, hospitality, offices, and retail. To date, private investment in IKN has reached 58 trillion rupiah and is expected to increase by 6.5 trillion rupiah in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: KPIG Sells Land in Bali Worth Rp5.5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: MNC Land has reached an agreement to sell the MNC Bali Resort land asset in Tanah Lot, Tabanan, Bali to PT Bumi Indah Prima for a total transaction value reaching 5.5 trillion rupiah. This transaction is targeted for completion in January 2025. The land asset is planned to be utilized for Transit Oriented Development within the Bali Urban Rail and Associated Development Project (Bali Subway).

tickerNews.title: Kobin Keramik Industri Increases Stake in CAKK via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The controller of Cahayaputra Asa Keramik, PT Kobin Keramik Industri, purchased 314 million CAKK shares at a transaction price of 145 rupiah per share on December 19, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 45.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kobin Keramik Industri's ownership in CAKK increased from 62.55% to 88.64%.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Cement Sales Volume Declined in November 2024
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia recorded cement sales volume of 3.5 million tons (-9% YoY, -7% MoM) in November 2024, which was worse than the industry's cement sales decline (excluding Semen Grobogan) of -6.6% YoY. This result brought SMGR's cement sales volume for 11M24 down to 35 million tons (-5% YoY). The annual volume decline in November 2024 was caused by a decrease in sales from Indonesian facilities to 3.4 million tons (-8% YoY, -6% MoM), followed by a decrease in sales from Vietnam facilities to 69 thousand tons (-37% YoY, -22% MoM). Segment-wise, the portion of bagged cement sales in November 2024 reached 68.5% of total sales (vs. October 2024: 69.8%).

tickerNews.title: TOBA Confirms Two New Renewable Energy Power Plants Operational in 2025
tickerNews.content: SVP Corporate Strategy & Investor Relations of TBS Energi Utama, Nafi Sentausa, stated that the company ensures 2 new and renewable energy (EBT) power plant projects will be operational in 2025. Nafi mentioned that the two projects are the Sumber Jaya mini-hydro power plant (PLTMH) in West Lampung with a capacity of 2x3 megawatts (MW) and the floating solar power plant (PLTS) Tembesi in Batam with a capacity of 46 megawatt peak (MWp).

tickerNews.title: ULTJ Incurs Rp351 Billion in Capex until 3Q24 for Expansion
tickerNews.content: Corporate Secretary of Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company, Pahala Sihotang, stated that the company incurred capital expenditure of 351 billion rupiah until 3Q24 in line with plans for production and distribution facility additions. Pahala mentioned that the 2024 capital expenditure was primarily allocated for the development project of the distribution center and factory at MM2100, as well as efficiency improvements at old factories.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Starts Geothermal Exploration in Lampung and Prepares for Seulawah Agam Drilling
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy commenced a 55 MW geothermal energy potential exploration project in the Gunung Tiga area in Lampung as of Tuesday (17/12). Previously, PGEO also announced readiness to execute drilling in the Seulawah Agam geothermal working area (WKP), Aceh Besar, which holds a geothermal potential of 320 MW. The Director of Exploration and Development of PGEO, Edwil Suzandi, stated that drilling in this area will commence in 2025. PGEO itself targets an installed capacity increase from 672.5 MW to 1 GW within the next 2-3 years.

tickerNews.title: Japanese Investor to Acquire 25% Stake in HGII via Subsidiary Post-IPO
tickerNews.content: A Japanese investor, Shikoku Electric Power (TYO:9507), through its subsidiary SEP International Netherlands B.V. (SEPI), will purchase 25% of Hero Global Investment shares from the controlling shareholder of HGII. The transaction will be executed no later than 1 month after HGII's IPO. Following the transaction, the current ownership of the controlling shareholder will be 55% and SEPI will hold 25%.

tickerNews.title: ABMM and Subsidiary Secure $395 Million Credit Facility from Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama together with its subsidiary, PT Radhika Jananta Raya, obtained a credit facility of up to 395 million US dollars from Bank Mandiri (BMRI). The facility obtained is intended to repay bank loans and provide working capital for the company.
